subject: Converting Oracle's dialect of SQL to HSQLDB?
msgSnippet: I m becoming curious about HSQLDB (and other in-memory databases).  Our growing body of DBUnit-based tests are taking longer and longer to run and I feel it s
messageBody:
I'm becoming curious about HSQLDB (and other in-memory databases). Our growing body of DBUnit-based tests are taking longer and longer to run and I feel it's hurting quality.

Cavaet: I am not a database/SQL expert

I installed hsqldb and tried to run our DDL file that creates our unit-test database against it. We use Oracle for test/production now. The DDL is riddled with Oracle-specific cruft: NUMBER instead of INTEGER, VARCHAR2 vs VARCHAR, etc.

Is there an easy way to take a DDL file like this and convert it into a format that HSQLDB will grok? We currently use TOAD to generate the DDL file BTW if that matters.

THanks!


[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
